result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey Tremount Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -  Restitution to be determined at restitution hearing on August 24, 2016.  Restitution to be paid during the term of extended supervision. Restitution to be paid before the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

*10/26/2021  Honorable Mark A. Sanders.  Order.  Count #1:  4 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended as each count, concurrent to the sentences imposed as to case #16CF001697 and case #16CF000484, but consecutive to any other sentence.  All other terms and conditions of the Judgment of Conviction will remain unchanged.*
Concurrent with: *10/26/2021  Concurrent with the sentences imposed as to case #16CF001697 and case #16CF000484, but consecutive to any  other sentence.*
concurrent to the sentences imposed as to Case# 16CF000484 and Case# 16CF001697, but consecutive to the sentence now being served.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 5 (five) years of the initial confinement has been served.

superMiscConds.notes:
-  Vocational training
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school

-  No illegal substances
-  No Contact Order with read-in offenses:  Star Comm 3 retail store, 3301 West North Avenue, City of Milwaukee   AND/OR   Haithan A.
-  No Contact Order with Pick 'n Save grocery store, 2355 North 35th Street, City of Milwaukee

-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)

-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random screens

supervisions.notes: COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey Tremount Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Order
-  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED BY THE COURT that the Stipulation signed by the parties on October  26, 2021 is approved. The Court hereby orders that the sentence in the above captioned case be amended as follows:

Case 15CF1154
Count #1:   4 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended as to each count, concurrent to the sentences imposed as to Case# 16CF001697 and Case# 16CF000484, but consecutive to any other sentence. All other terms and conditions of the Judgement of Conviction will remain unchanged. 

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. mag
Stipulation for sentence modification, signed by parties.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Assistant District Attorney Margaret Kunisch the state is essentially willing to concede the issue of further restitution on these matters. The victims had all been notified of both the sentencing hearing and this week's restitution hearing and Sentry was the only store making a request. Court ordered restitution to Sentry on August 24, 2016 and no further requests received so next court date on August 29, 2016 will be vacated.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Corey Tremount Wilson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Corey Tremount Wilson in custody at Fox Lake Correctional.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for restitution hearing. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 37. Court ordered defendant's appearance waived from Fox Lake Correctional for next scheduled date. COURT RETAINED COURT FILE.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
-of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-Received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Offer letter from Asst. District Atty. M. Kunisch to Atty. B. Krause dated April 6, 2016 and list of No Contact locations, offense dates and restitution amounts being sought.

Defendant Corey Tremount Wilson in court with Attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Corey Tremount Wilson in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  10  years, concurrent to the sentences imposed as to Case# 16CF000484 and Case# 16CF001697, but consecutive to the sentence now being served  -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  5  years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  5  years.  

Court finds defendant is  NOT  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 5 (five) years of the initial confinement has been served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random screens
-  No illegal substances
-  Vocational training
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school
-  No Contact Order with read-in offenses:  Star Comm 3 retail store, 3301 West North Avenue, City of Milwaukee   AND/OR   Haithan A.
-  No Contact Order with Pick 'n Save grocery store, 2355 North 35th Street, City of Milwaukee
-  Restitution to be determined at restitution hearing.  Restitution to be paid during the term of extended supervision.  Restitution to be paid before the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 28.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Branch 37,  in Room 313 of the Safety Bldg.
Clerk:  jms
For sentencing hearing 6/28/16 in branch 28.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Corey Tremount Wilson in court with Attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Corey Tremount Wilson in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

The two uncharged offenses detailed in the criminal complaint will be read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI  not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Defendant remanded pending sentencing.
